info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 3:07PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Granite and central Powell Counties through 345 PM MDT... At 306 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles north of Drummond, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include...Helmville. This includes Highway 200 E between mile markers 47 and 64. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
